definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: These are remains of an abandoned radar station Chernobyl-2.
sentences.chinese: 这是切尔若贝利2号雷达站的遗迹。

sentences.english: The relics left by the aztecs bespeak a high degree of civilization.
sentences.chinese: 阿兹提克族人的遗迹证明其拥有高度文明。

sentences.english: In the South-East part of the complex there was a wine presser.
sentences.chinese: 遗迹的西南部是一个葡萄酒加工厂。

sentences.english: They are typical geological remains from the Glacial Age.
sentences.chinese: 是典型的冰川期地质遗迹。

sentences.english: The appeal of geological traces is limited as a tourism resource.
sentences.chinese: 地质遗迹作为旅游资源，其吸引力有一定的局限性。

sentences.english: We visited the ruins of the Yuanmingyuan yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我们参观了圆明园遗迹。

sentences.english: Buddha statue brings life to the stone remnants of Angkor Thom.
sentences.chinese: 佛像为吴哥城的石头遗迹带来了生机。

sentences.english: The pottery workshop site was discovered in the city site of Zheng and Han states.
sentences.chinese: 在郑韩故城发现的陶作坊遗址，主要遗迹有窑址群。

sentences.english: Still, traces of charm and bygone ambition survive.
sentences.chinese: 象征昔日魅力及抱负的遗迹尚存。

sentences.english: All that remains of this building is the " Western Wall, " also known as the "Wailing Wall.
sentences.chinese: 存留至今的圣殿遗迹只有其西墙，即著名的“哭墙”。

sentences.english: The building stands as the last remaining relic of the town's cotton industry.
sentences.chinese: 这座建筑物是小镇棉纺业仅存的遗迹。

sentences.english: Red Palace revolutionary relics, each year attracts many visitors come to visit.
sentences.chinese: 红宫革命遗迹，每年都吸引着很多游人前来参观。

sentences.english: He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wire.
sentences.chinese: 他注意到一条缠绕在那根电线的蛇的遗迹。
诺亚方舟遗迹被发现了？

sentences.english: The coccyx is the remnant of what was once a human tail.
sentences.chinese: 尾椎骨是我们曾经有的那条长尾巴的遗迹。

sentences.english: There are numerous obvious remains of ancient earthquake along the Daqing-ridge.
sentences.chinese: 大箐梁子一带有着众多明显的古地震遗迹。

definition: places of historic interest/historical sites/CL:個|个[ge4]
underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
